result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek R. Wallace

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 16, 2022 at 08:05 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 1:25 pm. 

Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes deft. is not eligible for PD appointment. Court questions deft. as to counsel. Deft. requests additional time and waives time limits for preliminary hearing. COURT accepts waiver.
Prelim set for 11/07/2022 to be removed from calendar. 
CC: 11/16/2022 @ 8:05 am, Branch 4.

Adj: 1:32 pm.

Review hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): Officer Zach Ruesch or Marathon County Sheriff's Dept unless in officer's official capacity or need to contact MNSO. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

ADDRESS INFO for Derek R. Wallace
Current: 225600 County Road D, Norrie, WI 54440   (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 225600 County Road D, Tnorrie, WI 54440

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:21 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Paige Metzman.   

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 

BOND:  $2000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Officer Zach Ruesch or Marathon County Sheriff's Dept unless in officer's official capacity or need to contact MNSO.  
- Prints and photograph. 

RH:  11/02/22 at 1:00 p.m. 
PH:  11/07/22 at 9:30 a.m. 

Defendant's address should be NORRIE, WI. 

Adj:  2:24 p.m. 

Branch 4.
